    "target_population": "Women in poorest and most marginalized households"
  },
  "intervention_components": {

    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "The treatment increased households' consumption and revenues, reduced food insecurity, improved psychological well-being for women and men, increased women's market work participation (reducing their idle time), improved children's school attendance and physical health, and reduced their poverty prevalence by 20 percentage points",
